newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lankan navy sinks Tamil Tiger rebel boat.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lankan navy sinks Tamil Tiger rebel boat.

text.p: Sri Lankan navy patrols sank a high-speed Tamil Tiger guerrilla boat off the Indian Ocean island's east coast on Tuesday, killing at least five rebels, navy officials said.
The rebel boat was destroyed after a chase off Kokilai, about 260 km (163 miles) northeast of the capital Colombo, early on Tuesday, they said.
The navy has stepped up attacks in recent weeks against the Tamil Tiger rebels' Sea Tiger naval wing.
The Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam are fighting for an independent homeland for minority Tamils in the north and east.
The government says more than 50,000 people have died in the war, now in its 14th year, but the rebels say the death toll is higher.
